title: How Many Calories in a Glass of White Wine?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a glass of white wine, including carbs, alcohol content, and nutrition breakdowns for a standard 150 ml serving.
h1: How Many Calories in a Glass of White Wine?
assumptions: Standard 150 ml serving of dry white wine (e.g., Sauvignon Blanc), 12% ABV, no added sugars or mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, sweetness, alcohol content, brand, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 150 ml glass of dry white wine contains about 123 kcal, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Chilled with ice (diluted by 20 ml melt)

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of white wine?
faqs.a: Approximately 123 kcal for a standard 150 ml glass of dry white wine.
Yes, about 3.8 g carbs per 150 ml glass, mainly from sugars and alcohol.

faqs.q: How does sweetness affect calories in white wine?
faqs.a: Sweeter varieties add 20-50 kcal per glass due to higher residual sugars.

faqs.q: What's the alcohol content in a glass of white wine?
faqs.a: Typically 12% ABV in a 150 ml glass, contributing most of the calories.

faqs.q: Are there calories in dry vs. sweet white wine?
faqs.a: Dry: ~123 kcal; sweet: up to 170 kcal per 150 ml glass.
